com.soa.message.handler

Class HandlerChainFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.soa.message.handler.HandlerChainFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HandlerFactory

    public class HandlerChainFactory
extends java.lang.Object
implements HandlerFactory
    HandlerFactory implementation that builds a chain of MessageHandlers. The chain is returned as a composite MessageHandler. The MessageHandlers in the chain are created by calling a configured list of MessageHandlerFactories.
    Since:
    3.1

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HandlerChainFactory()
      Default constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      MessageHandler create(HandlerContext context, HandlerRole role)
      Creates a ChainHandler that implements a chain of handlers.
      void setCloseInReverse(boolean closeInReverse)
      Configures whether the handlers in the chain should be closed in reverse order.
      void setHandleOutInReverse(boolean handleInReverse)
      Configures whether the handlers in the chain should be called in reverse for out/fault messages.
      void setHandlerFactories(java.util.List handlerFactories)
      Configures the list of HandlerFactories to invoke to create the handler chain.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • HandlerChainFactory

        public HandlerChainFactory()
        Default constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • setHandlerFactories

        public void setHandlerFactories(java.util.List handlerFactories)
        Configures the list of HandlerFactories to invoke to create the handler chain.
        Parameters:
        handlerFactories - List of HandlerFactory objects.

      • setHandleOutInReverse

        public void setHandleOutInReverse(boolean handleInReverse)
        Configures whether the handlers in the chain should be called in reverse for out/fault messages.
        Parameters:
        handleInReverse - True if handlers should be called in reverse, false if not. Default is true.

      • setCloseInReverse

        public void setCloseInReverse(boolean closeInReverse)
        Configures whether the handlers in the chain should be closed in reverse order.
        Parameters:
        closeInReverse - True if handlers should be closed in reverse order, false if not. Default is true.

      • create

        public MessageHandler create(HandlerContext context,
                             HandlerRole role)
                      throws GException
        Creates a ChainHandler that implements a chain of handlers.
        Specified by:
        create in interface HandlerFactory
        Parameters:
        context - HandlerContext describing the scope of the handler chain.
        role - HandlerRole of the created handler.
        Returns:
        ChainHandler with nested handlers, null if no factories have been configured.
        Throws:
        GException - Thrown if an error was encountered trying to create the handler.
